what_program_does_description_1: ReConnect provides loans, grants, and loan-grant combinations to bring high-speed internet to rural areas that lack sufficient access.
what_program_does_description_2: Funds can be used to build, improve, or acquire facilities and equipment needed for high-speed internet service.
what_program_does_description_3: We also encourage private-sector investments in broadband infrastructure to get high-speed internet service to rural homes, businesses, and essential community facilities that support public safety, health care, schools, libraries, business and industry, and agricultural operations.
who_can_apply_applicant_type_2: Corporations, limited liability companies, or limited liability partnerships
who_can_apply_applicant_type_3: State, local, and Tribal governments, and their affiliated organizations
eligible_use_of_funds_1: Purchase an existing system that does not currently provide sufficient broadband access
eligible_use_of_funds_2: Offset portions of approved pre-application expenses, including environmental reviews
eligible_use_of_funds_3: Build or improve facilities capable of delivering broadband service to every premises in the PFSA at the same time
what_is_an_eligible_area_criteria_2: Ninety percent of households must lack sufficient access to broadband service.
what_is_considered_rural_definition: Service areas cannot be located in cities, towns, or incorporated areas with populations greater than 20,000, or in urbanized areas adjacent cities or towns with populations greater than 50,000.
how_do_we_apply_method: You can submit your application through USDA Rural Development's online application system
who_can_answer_questions_webinars_worksh: We generally host webinars and workshops during open application windows.
who_can_answer_questions_gfr_info: Your Telecommunications General Field Representative (GFR) also can help.
what_governs_this_program_act_name: The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2018 (Public Law 115-141)
note_general_advice: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
